Package theater

Class Application

java.lang.Object
theater.Application
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Application
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
Class representing the Theater Application
Author:
Pablo Cuesta Sierra (pablo.cuestas@estudiante.uam.es), Pablo Fernández Alegre (pablo.fernandezalegre@estudiante.uam.es) and Álvaro Zamanillo Sáez (alvaro.zamanillo@estudiante.uam.es)
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Application getInstance()
      Get instance (singleton pattern)
      Returns:
      the instance of the application

    • getInstanceFromFile

      public static Application getInstanceFromFile​(java.lang.String file)
      Get an instance from a file (and update the instance of the class). This is the correct way of reading the application from a file to use it later. If there is an error this method returns null and does not change the instance of the class.
      Parameters:
      file - file where the application is stored
      Returns:
      the new instance or null in case of error.

    • getInstanceFromFile

      public static Application getInstanceFromFile()
      Same as getInstanceFromFile, but the file is the default
      Returns:
      the new instance from the default file or null in case of error.

    • getNewInstanceForTests

      public static Application getNewInstanceForTests()
      New instance of application so that each unit test in the tester files can have a new instance of the application.
      Returns:
      a new instance of Application.

      Add a new cycle to the theater application
      Parameters:
      c - cycle to be added
      Returns:
      false if prices are not correctly set in some performance of the cycle

    • searchEvents

      public java.util.List<Event> searchEvents​(SearchBy searchBy, ISearchOnly searchOnly, java.lang.String input)
      search Events that contains input in its title, director or author
      Parameters:
      searchBy - attribute of event to filter
      searchOnly - type of event to search (concert, play or dance)
      input - substring to use in the match
      Returns:
      the result of the search

    • searchEvents

      public java.util.List<Event> searchEvents​(SearchBy searchBy, java.lang.String input)
      Search Events that contains input in its title, director or author
      Parameters:
      searchBy - attribute of event to filter
      input - substring to use in the match
      Returns:
      the result of the search

    • searchPerformances

      public java.util.List<Performance> searchPerformances​(SearchBy searchBy, ISearchOnly searchOnly, java.lang.String input, java.time.LocalDate d1, java.time.LocalDate d2)
      Search performances that contains input in its title, director or author. Search only in one type of events. With bounds for the date of the performance.
      Parameters:
      searchBy - attribute of event to filter
      searchOnly - type of event to search (concert, play or dance)
      input - substring to use in the match
      d1 - lower limit of dates to search
      d2 - upper limit of dates to search
      Returns:
      the result of the search

    • searchPerformances

      public java.util.List<Performance> searchPerformances​(SearchBy searchBy, java.lang.String input, java.time.LocalDate d1, java.time.LocalDate d2)
      Search performances that contains input in its title, director or author. With bounds for the date of the performance.
      Parameters:
      searchBy - attribute of event to filter
      input - substring to use in the match
      d1 - lower limit of dates to search
      d2 - upper limit of dates to search
      Returns:
      the result of the search

    • searchPerformances

      public java.util.List<Performance> searchPerformances​(SearchBy searchBy, ISearchOnly searchOnly, java.lang.String input)
      Search performances that contains input in its title, director or author. Search only in one type of events.
      Parameters:
      searchBy - attribute of event to filter
      searchOnly - type of event to search (concert, play or dance)
      input - substring to use in the match
      Returns:
      the result of the search

    • register

      public boolean register​(java.lang.String userName, java.lang.String password)
      Register a user
      Parameters:
      userName - username to register
      password - the password of the username
      Returns:
      false iff the username already exists

    • getUser

      public RegUser getUser​(java.lang.String userName)
      The user with this username from the app
      Parameters:
      userName - username of the user that is going to be returned
      Returns:
      the user with this username or null if it does not exist

    • logout

      public void logout()
      Logs out the current user

    • login

      public boolean login​(java.lang.String userName, java.lang.String password)
      Login of a user using its username and password
      Parameters:
      userName - the username
      password - the password
      Returns:
      true if the user was correctly logged in false if the user does not exist in the app, or if there is already a logged in user, or if the password is not correct.

    • login

      public boolean login​(java.lang.String userName, java.lang.String password, java.time.LocalDate currentDate)
      Login of a user using its username and password (for the simulation using the current date field)
      Parameters:
      userName - the username
      password - the password
      currentDate - date to update the date of the application (to be used only for simulation)
      Returns:
      true if the user was correctly logged in false if the user does not exist in the app, or if there is already a logged in user, or if the password is not correct.

    • addArea

      public boolean addArea​(Area a)
      Add an area to the app if there are no future performances
      Parameters:
      a - area to add (only added if it is not an empty composite area)
      Returns:
      true if the area was added

    • removeArea

      public boolean removeArea​(Area a)
      Removes an area from the app if there are no future performances
      Parameters:
      a - area to remove (of any kind)
      Returns:
      true if the area was removed correctly (false if the area was not in the app or if there are future performances)

    • addEvent

      public void addEvent​(Event event)
      Add a new event to the application. The event is only added if it is not already in the appication
      Parameters:
      event - event to add

    • canAddNewPerformance

      public boolean canAddNewPerformance​(java.time.LocalDate date)
      Returns true if a new performance can be set on the date
      Parameters:
      date - the date where the performance is going to be
      Returns:
      true iff there are no performances on that date
